CVE.summary: Unspecified vulnerability in the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) component in Oracle Java SE 7 Update 17 and earlier, 6 Update 43 and earlier, and 5.0 Update 41 and earlier; and OpenJDK 6 and 7; allows remote attackers to affect confidentiality, integrity, and availability via unknown vectors related to 2D, a different vulnerability than CVE-2013-1569, CVE-2013-2384, and CVE-2013-2420. NOTE: the previous information is from the April 2013 CPU. Oracle has not commented on claims from another vendor that this issue is related to "handling of [a] glyph table" in the International Components for Unicode (ICU) Layout Engine before 51.2.

IAVM.title: Multiple Vulnerabilities in Java for Mac OS X

vFeed.Product: vFeed - The Correlated Vulnerability and Threat Database
vFeed.Author: NJ OUCHN

Oval.title: SUSE-SU-2013:0835-3 -- Security update for IBM Java
SUSE-SU-2013:0835-1 -- Security update for IBM Java
SUSE-SU-2013:0871-1 -- Security update for IBM Java 1.7.0
HP-UX Running Java, Remote Unauthorized Access, Disclosure of Information, and Other Vulnerabilities

Vulnerability in the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) component in Oracle Java SE 7
		          Update 17 and earlier, 6 Update 43 and earlier, 5 Update 41 and earlier can result in
		          unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some Java Runtime Environment accessible
		          data as well as read access to a subset of Java Runtime Environment accessible
		          data.
SUSE-SU-2013:0871-2 -- Security update for IBM Java
HP-UX Running Java5 Runtime Environment (JRE) and Java Developer Kit (JDK), Remote Unauthorized Access, Disclosure of Information, and Other Vulnerabilities
